content.question: An <math alttext="8 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>8</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> object is moving with a speed of <math alttext="6 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>6</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> along a horizontal surface while a <math alttext="4 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mtext>-kg</mtext></math> object is moving in the opposite direction with a speed of <math alttext="3 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> on the same surface. The objects collide and stick together after the collision. Friction between the objects and the surface is negligible. What is the decrease in total kinetic energy of the two-object system during the collision?

choices.label: <math alttext="54 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>54</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>
<math alttext="90 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>90</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>
<math alttext="108 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>108</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>
<math alttext="162 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>162</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="108 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>108</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mi mathvariant="normal">J</mi></math>
